citation.article-title: Pelotomaculum propionicicum sp. nov., an anaerobic, mesophilic, obligately syntrophic, propionate-oxidizing bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pelotomaculum propionicicum sp. nov.
Pelotomaculum propionicicum (pro.pi.o.ni′ci.cum. N.L. neut. adj. propionicicum referring to the substrate propionic acid, which can be metabolized by the species).
The organism only grows syntrophically on propionate with hydrogenotrophic methanogens.
Although the organism does not demonstrate sulfate reduction, it has dsrAB genes that are essential for sulfate respiration.
Cells are 2.0–4.0 μm long and 1.0 μm wide, occurring singly or in pairs.
The pH range for growth is 6.5–7.5 (optimum: 6.5–7.2).
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–0.5 % NaCl, but does not occur in the presence of greater than 1.0 % NaCl.
Habitat is an anaerobic, mesophilic granular sludge.
The strain is stored in the DSM and JCM culture collections as a defined co-culture with Methanospirillum hungatei.
